result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew N. Rupiper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine/Methamphetamine/etc.(>50g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense, Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)4.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $553.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in treatment, and only with prior agent approval.
Full compliance with the conditions and requirements of the Marinette County Drug Court Treatment program.

Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 8-26-2022.

timeConds.notes:
1 yr jail, imposed and stayed, to be used by the Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.
Deft to remain in the Marinette County Jail until a member of the Drug Court team comes to get him and when a bed is available at the Anthony House.

records.addlTxt:
11:39 AM Defendant Matthew N. Rupiper in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr in court for Matthew N. Rupiper.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case. 
Atty Skorr provides plea form.
DA heard on agreement.
Atty Skorr agrees.
DA reads charge in Count 4.
Court arraigns Deft on Count 4.
Deft enters a plea of no contest.
Non-citizen advisory.
Court reviews maximum penalties.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Read-ins.
Deft understands.
Atty Skorr satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court reviews prior convictions.
Atty Skorr agrees.
Deft agrees.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds Deft guilty to Count 4.
Court dismisses and reads-in Counts 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, and 7.
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court imposed and stayed on Count 4:
4 years initial confinement, 4 years extended supervision, consecutive to any other sentence, and places Deft on probation for 3 years.
Credit for 15 days time served.
Not eligible for CIP and SAP.
Conditions of probation:
Full compliance with the conditions and requirements of the Marinette County Drug Court Treatment program.
1 year jail, imposed and stayed, to be used by the Treatment Court Judge for treatment or sanction purposes.
Payment of costs + service fees + DNA surcharge = $553.00 - payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No contact with known drug users or sellers, except in treatment, and only with prior agent approval.
Completion of all assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent.
DNA sample due 08-26-2022.
No firearms.
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights.
Deft to remain in the Marinette County Jail until a member of the Drug Court team comes to get him and when a bed is available at the Anthony House.
12:06 PM

10:13 AM Defendant Matthew N. Rupiper in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr in court for Matthew N. Rupiper.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case.
Atty Skorr heard - Deft has been accepted to the Marinette County Drug Court program.
No bed available at Anthony House yet.
Requests a plea and sentencing date.
DA heard.
Court heard - due to congestion of court calendar this morning, we will adjourn this hearing until 11:30 today.
10:17 AM
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Signature bond modified to a cash bond w/ same conditions as previously ordered.

2:31 PM Defendant Matthew N. Rupiper appeared by ZOOM, in custody.  Attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Amanda Marie Skorr appeared by ZOOM for Matthew N. Rupiper.
Court calls case.
Court reviews motion filed by the State to modify bond to a cash bond.
DA heard on motion and bond recommendation.
Atty Skorr heard. 
Court heard and modifies bond to $5000 cash bond with all the same conditions as previously ordered on the signature bond.
Atty Skorr heard - has efiled a prelim questionnaire today.
2:41 Waiver of prelim.
Court reviews form with Deft.
PrelimQues/WOR.
Deft waives prelim.
Atty Skorr is satisfied.
Court accepts the waiver and finds deft freely waives prelim 
Deft bound over for trial.
2:44 Arriagnment.
DA to have the information to be filed by the close of business tomorrow. 
Atty Sckorr - waives a formal reading and enters not guilty pleas.
Request status.
Court schedules with parties.
2:47 PM
Adjourned initial appearance on August 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.

8:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew N. Rupiper appeared by video, in custody. 
Court calls case. 
Copy of complaint. 
Charges and max penalties. 
Deft spks- has spoke with Public Defender and one has not been appointed. 
ADA spks on bond recommendation. 
Court imposes $2,500 signature bond with conditions: sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substance without a valid Rx, and no contact with CO-Deft S.B.
Court schedules with parties. 
8:52 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
